summary: Data brokers collect and sell personal information, creating a market for targeted advertising and risk assessment. Consumers should limit data sharing and utilize privacy tools to reduce their digital footprint and limit data collection. Understanding data broker practices helps startups strategize ethical data acquisition and prioritize user privacy, leading to improved trust.

title: Data Dealers and Bomb Plots : Inside the Netherlands Shadowy Market for Stolen Data
combined_text: Data Dealers and Bomb Plots : Inside the Netherlands Shadowy Market for Stolen Data. occrp.org.
summary: The Dutch shadow market for stolen data is thriving, with data brokers offering sensitive personal information. Criminals are purchasing data to facilitate fraud, identity theft, and even plan violent attacks, showing critical risk. Data breaches are a serious issue; 70% of Dutch citizens are likely victims of data leaks.

title: California bolsters its data broker regulations via amendment | Orrick , Herrington & Sutcliffe LLP
combined_text: California bolsters its data broker regulations via amendment | Orrick , Herrington & Sutcliffe LLP. jdsupra.com.
summary: California's SB 362 significantly expands data broker registration obligations to include more entities.  The amended law mandates a deletion mechanism for consumers affecting data sharing, potentially disrupting current practices. Starting January 1, 2026, brokers must conduct biennial audits, demonstrating compliance and potentially revealing vulnerabilities.
